Sentence 1: Coronary circulation is crucial for supplying oxygen to the heart
Sentence 2: The heart, a muscle, requires a constant supply of oxygen to function effectively

Sentence 1: The heart, a muscle, requires a constant supply of oxygen to function effectively
Sentence 2: Coronary arteries deliver this oxygenated blood directly to the myocardium, the heart muscle

Sentence 1: Coronary arteries deliver this oxygenated blood directly to the myocardium, the heart muscle
Sentence 2: Without this circulation, the heart would not be able to contract and pump blood throughout the body

Sentence 2: Coronary arteries branch off from the aorta and supply the myocardium, ensuring that the heart receives the oxygen it needs to continue its work
